name: degressive
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
finance & economics
  specialized A degressive tax system is one in which the rate of tax is lower on larger amounts of money: A degressive income tax takes a smaller fraction of higher incomes. Some believe that the rates should be degressive in relation to the price. Compare
progressive
formal gradually reducing by small amounts : This does not change the degressive tendency of the crater volume.
More examplesFewer examplesFee scales are usually degressive, i.e. the rate for large orders is less than for small orders.Some people felt that the royalty rates for auction houses should be degressive in relation to the price of the artwork.
